result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Sheridan Haar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the plea agreement.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea to Counts 2 & 3.  
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the information for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3.  Counts 1 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that Ms. Harr has waived the no contact and is present in court today.  Court questions Ms. Harr.  Ms. Harr asks that the no contact be lifted.  Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Withhold sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $268.00
$100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
  DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent; including Domestic Abuse or Anger Management counseling
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Ct. 3:  Withhold sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent; including Domestic Abuse or Anger Management counseling

Credit = 4 days (if revoked)
Counts 1 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.
bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it

Defendant Robert Sheridan Haar in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Lawton, there will be a plea today.  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 2 & 3.  Counts 1 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  Both parties will be waiving the request for a PSI.   Atty Lawton agrees.
Atty Lawton states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Lawton states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.

Waiver of No Contact Provision of Bond
Unapproved  at this time per BNB
Motion hearing on November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Hendee asking to reset the Oct. 5th Prelim; ok'd by Judge.

Statement of Compliance
s/CIJ, Victin Witness Coordinator
Criminal Complaint served on Defendant by MASO @ Jail
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

with conditions:
*No contact with T.H. or her residence
*Defendant is allowed one time with Law Enforcement to return to the home to get his belongings.
*No contact with M.S.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.

Court questions the defendant regarding time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives time limits for the Prelim.
BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set Prelim.

Defendant Robert Sheridan Haar in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.

Atty Hendee requests a $2,500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant states that he has children and he cannot pay the cash bond; requests signature bond.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,500 Cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with T.H. or her residence
*Defendant is allowed one time with Law Enforcement to return to the home to get his belongings.
*No contact with M.S.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
